description.narrative: Business Center Zvecan and its employees and trainers through building capacity of the organization as main support entity for entrepreneurs of Northern Kosovo. Entrepreneurs and SME established in the previous phase of the project, Start-ups and existing businesses, entrepreneurs from North Kosovo municipalities: Zvecan, Mitrovica, Leposavic and Zubin Potok. Young entrepreneurs, as promoters of new development initiatives. Farmers from North Kosovo. Community of the North Kosovo.

In the previous phase of the project the awareness was raised on the importance of enhancing entrepreneurship and its potential role in overall economic development. Apart from awareness rising, steps were undertaken to build the capacity of the people supporting entrepreneurship (like Business Center Zvecan), or potential entrepreneurs themselves or local stakeholders who can successfully support and influence creation of Business supportive environment. Considerable efforts were put to achieve above results, however it was proved that such activities need continuation in order to provide further-reaching effects. Kosovos unemployment rate is estimated at 45.4% Kosovos Agency of Statistics (KAS) unemployment rate in 2009 (KAS, 2009). and is the highest in Europe. According to the KA Group research (2010), in the Mitrovica region it has reached 70% of the active population. Within Northern Kosovo, the environment for economic development was far from being conducive, due to continuing political dispute over the status of North Kosovo. Until 2010, the access to business education and consulting services was difficult due to the underdeveloped business development infrastructure. The existing registered SMEs were experiencing difficulties in accessing financial services due to the reduced number of financial service providers that operated in Northern Kosovo, restrictive credit extension policies in terms of credit history and collateral requirements, as well as the high cost of credit (15 25% interest rate declining per annum). Since June 2011, the two main financial services providers, ProCredit Bank and Raiffeissen Bank, have refrained from extending credits to the individuals and business in the Northern Kosovo (Mitrovica North, Zvečan, Zubin Potok and Leposavić), limiting the range of financial services to transfer of funds, payment of salaries, utilities, and establishment of saving accounts. In 2011 BCZ in cooperation with UNDP and SPARK, through NLB bank, started a micro crediting scheme, and more than 20 entrepreneurs were credited, to develop or start up a business. Even though situation for crediting start ups has not improved in 2013, there was surprisingly large number of candidates who were interested to learning how to make business plans and to gain other skills necessary to start up a business. Because of earlier mentioned BCZ decided in this year, to show and to teach our clients how not to rely on banks only but, to find other sources of funding and financing through Fundraising trainings as well as through matchmaking activities. Also BCZ became leading centre for entrepreneurial trainings, having trained more that 300 beneficiaries in years 2012 and 2013.
Output(s) Indicator (s): Target(s):
1.1 Capacity of BCZ staff increased in the area of fund raising and lobbying. Number of staff member certified 9/3 woman 1.2 Capacity of BCZ staff increased in the area of business entrepreneurship support Number of new activities that BCZ will introduce 1 1.4 Through successful meetings cooperation obtained Number of new projects 2 2.1Through successfully held trainings on topics of business and entrepreneurship trained and certified potential and existing entrepreneurs Number of potential and existing entrepreneurs certified 100/ 40 woman 2.2 Through successfully held trainings, and delivered grants new farms started Number of new family business started 10 2.3 Through delivered grants to entrepreneurs new jobs created Number of jobs created 40 2.4 New BCZ Clients from municipalities: Zubin Potok, Leposavic and Mitrovica Number of new BCZ clients registered in BCZ database 80/25 woman
2.5 Business plans approved and ready for finance. Approved business plans 50/25 woman
2.6 Best Business ideas approved Number of BBI forms approved 15/5 woman 2.7 Stimulation for business start up Number of awards given 12/3 women 2.8. Through successfully held B2B event matchmaking between entrepreneurs was realized Matches accomplished 10/3 woman 2.9 Through an educational study visit successful matchmaking between entrepreneurs was realized Matches accomplished 10/3 woman 2.10 Successfully held consultancy sessions and meetings for support, growth or start-up of SMEs Number of SMEs owners/ potential entrepreneurs supported by consultancy 40/12 woman 3.1 Joint activity of all MFS II members in order to solve Problems and remove barriers Number of research conducted 1
